```{r}
source("Utility Maximization.R")
source("Expenditure Minimization.R")
```

You just have to edit the parameters in the functions and "ctrl + enter" inside the cell block.

This is a test change.

```{r}
cobb_douglas_two_good_umax(
  A = 1,
  a1 = 0.75,
  a2 = 0.25,
  w1 = 6,
  w2 = 5,
  M = 50
)
```

```{r}
cobb_douglas_three_good_umax(
  A = 1,
  a1=0.75,
  a2=0.1,
  a3=0.15,
  w1=8,
  w2=6,
  w3=7,
  M=70,
)
```

```{r}
ces_two_good_umax(
  A = 1,
  sigma = 0.83,
  a1 = 0.33,
  a2 = 0.67,
  w1 = 7,
  w2 = 5,
  M = 45
)
```

```{r}
ces_three_good_umax(
  A = 1,
  sigma = 0.74,
  a1 = 0.33,
  a2 = 0.4,
  a3 = 0.27,
  w1 = 5,
  w2 = 8,
  w3 = 6,
  M = 56
)
```


```{r}
cobb_douglas_three_good_emin(

)
```

```{r}
ces_two_good_emin(
  A = 1,
```
